dji.sdk.api.GroundStation

Class DJIGroundStationFlyingInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.GroundStation.DJIGroundStationFlyingInfo

  • public class DJIGroundStationFlyingInfo
extends java.lang.Object

    DJI Ground Station Flying Information

    Flying Information is a structure containing data relevant to the aircraft's flight, including its pitch, roll, yaw, and velocity components. This data can be used to monitor the execution of a ground station task. The GPS status allows you to judge how conducive the environment is to flying the aircraft.
    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software
    See Also:
    DJIGroundStation

    • Field Detail

      • targetWaypointIndex

        public int targetWaypointIndex
        The waypoint index of the waypoint the aircraft is flying towards. If the aircraft is currently executing actions at a waypoint, targetWaypointIndex will be the index of the waypoint the aircraft is currently at. The moment the aircraft finishes executing its actions, targetWaypointIndex will update to the index of the next waypoint. The value of this property will be set to -1 if the ground station task has not started yet.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationWaypoint

      • pitch

        public float pitch
        The aircraft's current pitch. Pitch is a measure of the drone's rotation about the lateral axis, also known as the x-axis (imagine a line going through the left and right sides of the aircraft). Please refer to our Mobile SDK Handbook for additional explanation.

      • roll

        public float roll
        The aircraft's current roll. Roll is a measure of the drone's rotation about the longitudinal axis, also known as the y-axis (imagine a line going through the front and back of the aircraft). Please refer to our Mobile SDK Handbook for additional explanation.

      • yaw

        public float yaw
        The aircraft's current yaw, in degrees. Yaw is a measure of the drone's rotation about the vertical axis, also known as the z-axis (imagine a line going through the top and bottom of the drone).
        The range is [-180, 180], where 0 represents true north. Rotating clockwise increases they aw up to 180 degrees, while moving anti-clockwise decreases the yaw to a minimum of -180 degrees. Hence, 180 and -180 both represent true south.
        Please refer to our Mobile SDK Handbook for additional explanation.

      • velocityX

        public float velocityX
        The aircraft's velocity, in decimeters (10cm) per second, in the x-axis. The x-axis is also known at the lateral, or pitch, axis.

      • velocityY

        public float velocityY
        The aircraft's velocity, in decimeters (10cm) per second, in the y-axis. The y-axis is also known as the longitudinal, or roll, axis.

      • velocityZ

        public float velocityZ
        The aircraft's velocity in the z-axis. The z-axis is also known as the vertical, or yaw, axis.

      • altitude

        public float altitude
        The current altitude, in meters, of the aircraft.

      • homeLocationLatitude

        public double homeLocationLatitude
        The home point location's latitude, in degrees. Home point is the point from which the drone has taken off from. The home point can also be set in DJIMainController.
        See Also:
        DJIMainController

      • homeLocationLongitude

        public double homeLocationLongitude
        The home point location's longitude, in degrees. Home point is the point from which the drone has taken off from. The home point can also be set in DJIMainController.
        See Also:
        DJIMainController

      • droneLocationLatitude

        public double droneLocationLatitude
        The aircraft's current latitude, in degrees.

      • droneLocationLongitude

        public double droneLocationLongitude
        The aircraft's current longitude, in degrees.

      • flightMode

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationFlightMode flightMode
        The mode of ground station control of the aircraft. For example, the aircraft may currently be being instructed to hover, land, go home etc.

      • gpsStatus

        public DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationGpsStatus gpsStatus
        The GPS status of the aircraft when using the ground station. Gives the strength of the aircraft's GPS signal.
